intro: Lechea minor var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy lechea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. Its leaves are hairy, giving it the common name, and its flowers range in color from white to pale blue. It is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
